metadata.title: CVE-2022-3567 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability has been found in Linux Kernel and classified asproblematic. This vulnerability affects the functioninet6_stream_ops/inet6_dgram_ops of the component IPv6 Handler. Themanipulation leads to race condition. It is recommended to apply a patch tofix this issue. VDB-211090 is the identifier assigned to thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-generic - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-235-lowlatency - 4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-aws - 4.4.0-1114.120
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-azure - 4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-235.269~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.120').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2').
